physical_findings: Fleshy mass occupying almost whole of the anal lumen and reaching upto the anal verge
Ulcerating black-colored nodular growth starting at the anorectal junction and extending proximally

imaging_findings.Computed tomography (CT) scan of the abd: Polypoidal intraluminal mass in the rectum causing near total obliteration of the lumen, extending proximally from just below the rectosigmoid junction to the anal verge distally. Extramural extension of mass into peri-rectal fat planes with stranding. Loco-regional, para-aortic and external iliac lymphadenopathy suggestive of nodal metastasis. Loss of recto-vaginal fat plane with involvement of right postero-lateral wall of the vagina.
imaging_findings.MRI of pelvis: Heterogeneous mass in the rectum with intra- and extra-luminal extension along with involvement of mesorectal fat and postero-lateral wall of the vagina. The mass revealed heterogeneous signal intensity

required: Histopathological examination showing pleomorphic lesions displaying high mitotic rate and prominent nucleoli with intra- and extra-cellular melanin pigment
supportive: Clinical presentation with rectal bleeding, anal pain, anal mass, alteration in bowel habits
Imaging findings consistent with malignant melanoma
